li.p: Meals will be provided to all students and their siblings (ages 1 through 18) beginning March 23, 2020.
Meal pick-up will be at the side door of the auditorium of the Elementary School at the regular lower elementary pick up/drop off site (West 4th Street).
Please remain in your vehicle, and the meal(s) will be delivered to you.
Meals will be served from ll:30 a.m. until 12:30 p.m. Meals will also be delivered by regular bus routes with the buses leaving the school at 11:30 a.m. and running through their regular routes.
Meals can be picked up at the regular bus stop.

div.p: Learning Packets will be distributed beginning Monday, April 6th
Packets can be picked up from April 6th-8th from 9:00 a.m.-11:00 a.m

li.p: Pick-up will take place for ALL ELEMENTARY GRADE LEVELS at the west end of campus in front of the auditorium
﻿Middle School Distance Learning Packets are available in the front drive. (Bus pick up area.) (REMAIN IN YOUR VEHICLE)
﻿High School Distance Learning Packets are available at the west end doors. (Bus pick Up area) (REMAIN IN YOUR VEHICLE)

div.p: Students/Parents can send a picture of the completed Progress Monitoring/Parent Assurance checklist on each packet to their child’s teacher once all assignments have been completed. You can send the picture/image via email, Class Dojo, Google Classroom, Google hangouts, Facebook, etc. Your child’s teacher will let you know which way they prefer to receive documents.
Telephones at each site and the central office will be answered from 8:00 a.m. until 12:00 noon daily Monday through Thursday for any inquiries.

li.p: Sites: 918-465-2245 + site option (1 Elementary, 2 Middle School, 3 High School)
Contact your child’s teacher through E-Mail or Remind for their office hours.

p.strong: There is no time table that is set for students to return to the buildings to retrieve their personal items at this time.
Latimer County Resources for food, clothing, etc.

div.p: The Wilburton Public School web site is for informational and educational purposes only. Every attempt is taken to present accurate and up to date information. We cannot, however, guarantee that inaccuracies will not occur. The Wilburton Public School District will not be held responsible for any damage or inconvenience caused as a result of any error within these pages. For our patrons convenience, many pages contain links to outside sites. The Wilburton Public School District does not endorse or support these organizations, products or services. The Wilburton Public School District does not assume responsibility for the content of these pages. If you have concerns about the content of this site, Please contact our district webmaster.
